The option actually says erase entire disk, so, yes. Do you want to backup your home dir first?
tar -jcvf homebackup.tar.bz2 $HOME from ubuntu should do it
when i reinstall ubuntu i'll be able to use that back up? I just need the settings and app i've downloaded...
where ever you say homebackup.tar.bz2 will be. Then you can put that anywhere
don't worry, it's probably natty but that doesn't really matter too much
That command will only backup your settings
you'll still need to re-install the programs fresh
Once you've reinstalled, you unzip with tar -jxvf homebackup.tar.bz2 but execute from /home
If anything goes wrong, keep a hold of that file ;)
